lines.text: Velocity at an instant of time
Calculated using a small time interval
Instantaneous and average velocity can differ

secText:
Essential Question:
How do average velocity and instantaneous velocity differ?

Enduring Understandings:
1. Average velocity is the displacement divided by the elapsed time when the elapsed time is not miniscule.
2. Instantaneous velocity refers to the velocity of an object during a miniscule amount of time.
Vocabulary: average velocity, instantaneous velocity

STEM Skills:
1. Review how to calculate an average.
